trans-unit.source: Back up a Windows server or client to Azure | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Back up a Windows server or client to Azure | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Backup Windows servers or clients to Azure by creating a backup vault, downloading credentials, installing the backup agent, and completing an initial backup of your files and folders.
trans-unit.target: Backup Windows servers or clients to Azure by creating a backup vault, downloading credentials, installing the backup agent, and completing an initial backup of your files and folders.

trans-unit.source: Back up a Windows server or client to Azure
trans-unit.target: Back up a Windows server or client to Azure

trans-unit.source: This article covers the procedures that you need to follow to prepare your environment and back up a Windows server (or client) to Azure.
trans-unit.target: This article covers the procedures that you need to follow to prepare your environment and back up a Windows server (or client) to Azure.

trans-unit.source: It also covers considerations for deploying your backup solution.
trans-unit.target: It also covers considerations for deploying your backup solution.

trans-unit.source: If you're interested in trying Azure Backup for the first time, this article quickly walks you through the process.
trans-unit.target: If you're interested in trying Azure Backup for the first time, this article quickly walks you through the process.

trans-unit.source: Create vault
trans-unit.target: Create vault

trans-unit.source: Before you start
trans-unit.target: Before you start

trans-unit.source: To back up a server or client to Azure, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To back up a server or client to Azure, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have one, you can create a [free account](https://azure.microsoft.com/free/) in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have one, you can create a [free account](https://azure.microsoft.com/free/) in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Create a backup vault
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Create a backup vault

trans-unit.source: To back up files and folders from a server or client, you need to create a backup vault in the geographic region where you want to store the data.
trans-unit.target: To back up files and folders from a server or client, you need to create a backup vault in the geographic region where you want to store the data.

trans-unit.source: To create a backup vault
trans-unit.target: To create a backup vault

trans-unit.source: Sign in to [the Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/)
trans-unit.target: Sign in to [the Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/)

trans-unit.source: Click **New** > **Data Services** > **Recovery Services** > **Backup Vault**, and then choose **Quick Create**
trans-unit.target: Click **New** > **Data Services** > **Recovery Services** > **Backup Vault**, and then choose **Quick Create**

trans-unit.source: For the **Name** parameter, enter a friendly name for the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: For the **Name** parameter, enter a friendly name for the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: Type a name that contains between 2 and 50 characters.
trans-unit.target: Type a name that contains between 2 and 50 characters.

trans-unit.source: It must start with a letter, and can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens.
trans-unit.target: It must start with a letter, and can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens.

trans-unit.source: This name needs to be unique for each subscription.
trans-unit.target: This name needs to be unique for each subscription.

trans-unit.source: For the **Region** parameter, select the geographic region for the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: For the **Region** parameter, select the geographic region for the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: This choice determines the geographic region where your backup data is sent.
trans-unit.target: This choice determines the geographic region where your backup data is sent.

trans-unit.source: By choosing a geographic region that's close to your location, you can reduce network latency when backing up to Azure.
trans-unit.target: By choosing a geographic region that's close to your location, you can reduce network latency when backing up to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create Vault**
trans-unit.target: Click **Create Vault**

trans-unit.source: Create a backup vault
trans-unit.target: Create a backup vault

trans-unit.source: It can take a while for the backup vault to be created.
trans-unit.target: It can take a while for the backup vault to be created.

trans-unit.source: To check the status, monitor the notifications at the bottom of the portal.
trans-unit.target: To check the status, monitor the notifications at the bottom of the portal.

trans-unit.source: After the backup vault has been created, you'll see a message saying that the vault has been successfully created.
trans-unit.target: After the backup vault has been created, you'll see a message saying that the vault has been successfully created.

trans-unit.source: It also appears as **Active** in the **Recovery Services** resource list.
trans-unit.target: It also appears as **Active** in the **Recovery Services** resource list.

trans-unit.source: Creating vault status
trans-unit.target: Creating vault status

trans-unit.source: Select the storage redundancy option by following the steps described here.
trans-unit.target: Select the storage redundancy option by following the steps described here.

trans-unit.source: The best time to identify your storage redundancy option is right after vault creation and before any machines are registered to the vault.
trans-unit.target: The best time to identify your storage redundancy option is right after vault creation and before any machines are registered to the vault.

trans-unit.source: After an item has been registered to the vault, the storage redundancy option is locked and cannot be modified.
trans-unit.target: After an item has been registered to the vault, the storage redundancy option is locked and cannot be modified.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Azure as a primary backup storage endpoint (for example, you are backing up to Azure from a Windows server), consider picking (the default) [geo-redundant storage](../storage/storage-redundancy.md#geo-redundant-storage) option.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Azure as a primary backup storage endpoint (for example, you are backing up to Azure from a Windows server), consider picking (the default) [geo-redundant storage](../storage/storage-redundancy.md#geo-redundant-storage) option.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Azure as a tertiary backup storage endpoint (for example, you are using System Center Data Protection Manager to store a local backup copy on-premises and using Azure for long-term retention needs), consider choosing [locally redundant storage](../storage/storage-redundancy.md#locally-redundant-storage).
trans-unit.target: If you are using Azure as a tertiary backup storage endpoint (for example, you are using System Center Data Protection Manager to store a local backup copy on-premises and using Azure for long-term retention needs), consider choosing [locally redundant storage](../storage/storage-redundancy.md#locally-redundant-storage).

trans-unit.source: This brings down the cost of storing data in Azure, while providing a lower level of durability for your data that might be acceptable for tertiary copies.
trans-unit.target: This brings down the cost of storing data in Azure, while providing a lower level of durability for your data that might be acceptable for tertiary copies.

trans-unit.source: To select the storage redundancy option:
trans-unit.target: To select the storage redundancy option:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Click the vault you just created.
trans-unit.target: Click the vault you just created.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: On the Quick Start page, select **Configure**
trans-unit.target: On the Quick Start page, select **Configure**

trans-unit.source: Configure vault status
trans-unit.target: Configure vault status

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: Choose the appropriate storage redundancy option.
trans-unit.target: Choose the appropriate storage redundancy option.

trans-unit.source: If you select **Locally Redundant**, you need to click **Save** (because **Geo-Redundant** is the default option).
trans-unit.target: If you select **Locally Redundant**, you need to click **Save** (because **Geo-Redundant** is the default option).

trans-unit.source: d.
trans-unit.target: d.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, click **Recovery Services** to return to the list of resources for Recovery Services.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, click **Recovery Services** to return to the list of resources for Recovery Services.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Download the vault credential file
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Download the vault credential file

trans-unit.source: The on-premises machine needs to be authenticated with a backup vault before it can back up data to Azure.
trans-unit.target: The on-premises machine needs to be authenticated with a backup vault before it can back up data to Azure.

trans-unit.source: The authentication is achieved through *vault credentials*.
trans-unit.target: The authentication is achieved through *vault credentials*.

trans-unit.source: The vault credential file is downloaded through a secure channel from the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: The vault credential file is downloaded through a secure channel from the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The certificate private key does not persist in the portal or the service.
trans-unit.target: The certificate private key does not persist in the portal or the service.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [using vault credentials to authenticate with the Backup service](backup-introduction-to-azure-backup.md#what-is-the-vault-credential-file)
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [using vault credentials to authenticate with the Backup service](backup-introduction-to-azure-backup.md#what-is-the-vault-credential-file)

trans-unit.source: To download the vault credential file to a local machine
trans-unit.target: To download the vault credential file to a local machine

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, click **Recovery Services**, and then select the backup vault that you created.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, click **Recovery Services**, and then select the backup vault that you created.

trans-unit.source: IR complete
trans-unit.target: IR complete

trans-unit.source: On the Quick Start page, click **Download vault credentials**
trans-unit.target: On the Quick Start page, click **Download vault credentials**

trans-unit.source: The portal generates a vault credential by using a combination of the vault name and the current date.
trans-unit.target: The portal generates a vault credential by using a combination of the vault name and the current date.

trans-unit.source: The vault credentials file is used only during the registration workflow and expires after 48 hours.
trans-unit.target: The vault credentials file is used only during the registration workflow and expires after 48 hours.

trans-unit.source: The vault credential file can be downloaded from the portal.
trans-unit.target: The vault credential file can be downloaded from the portal.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to download the vault credential file to the Downloads folder of the local account.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to download the vault credential file to the Downloads folder of the local account.

trans-unit.source: You can also select **Save As** from the **Save** menu to specify a location for the vault credential file.
trans-unit.target: You can also select **Save As** from the **Save** menu to specify a location for the vault credential file.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the vault credential file is saved in a location that can be accessed from your machine.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the vault credential file is saved in a location that can be accessed from your machine.

trans-unit.source: If it is stored in a file share or server message block, verify that you have the permissions to access it.
trans-unit.target: If it is stored in a file share or server message block, verify that you have the permissions to access it.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Download, install, and register the Backup agent
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Download, install, and register the Backup agent

trans-unit.source: After you create the backup vault and download the vault credential file, an agent must be installed on each of your Windows machines.
trans-unit.target: After you create the backup vault and download the vault credential file, an agent must be installed on each of your Windows machines.

trans-unit.source: To download, install, and register the agent
trans-unit.target: To download, install, and register the agent

trans-unit.source: Click **Recovery Services**, and then select the backup vault that you want to register with a server.
trans-unit.target: Click **Recovery Services**, and then select the backup vault that you want to register with a server.

trans-unit.source: On the Quick Start page, click the agent **Agent for Windows Server or System Center Data Protection Manager or Windows client**.
trans-unit.target: On the Quick Start page, click the agent **Agent for Windows Server or System Center Data Protection Manager or Windows client**.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Save**
trans-unit.target: Then click **Save**

trans-unit.source: Save agent
trans-unit.target: Save agent

trans-unit.source: After the MARSagentinstaller.exe file has downloaded, click **Run** (or double-click **MARSAgentInstaller.exe** from the saved location).
trans-unit.target: After the MARSagentinstaller.exe file has downloaded, click **Run** (or double-click **MARSAgentInstaller.exe** from the saved location).

trans-unit.source: Choose the installation folder and cache folder that are required for the agent, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Choose the installation folder and cache folder that are required for the agent, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: The cache location you specify must have free space equal to at least 5 percent of the backup data.
trans-unit.target: The cache location you specify must have free space equal to at least 5 percent of the backup data.

trans-unit.source: You can continue to connect to the Internet through the default proxy settings.
trans-unit.target: You can continue to connect to the Internet through the default proxy settings.

trans-unit.source: If you use a proxy server to connect to the Internet, on the Proxy Configuration page, select the **Use custom proxy settings** check box, and then enter the proxy server details.
trans-unit.target: If you use a proxy server to connect to the Internet, on the Proxy Configuration page, select the **Use custom proxy settings** check box, and then enter the proxy server details.

trans-unit.source: If you use an authenticated proxy, enter the user name and password details, and then click **Next**
trans-unit.target: If you use an authenticated proxy, enter the user name and password details, and then click **Next**

trans-unit.source: Click **Install** to begin the agent installation.
trans-unit.target: Click **Install** to begin the agent installation.

trans-unit.source: The Backup agent installs .NET Framework 4.5 and Windows PowerShell (if it’s not already installed) to complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: The Backup agent installs .NET Framework 4.5 and Windows PowerShell (if it’s not already installed) to complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: After the agent is installed, click **Proceed to Registration** to continue with the workflow.
trans-unit.target: After the agent is installed, click **Proceed to Registration** to continue with the workflow.

trans-unit.source: On the Vault Identification page, browse to and select the vault credential file that you previously downloaded.
trans-unit.target: On the Vault Identification page, browse to and select the vault credential file that you previously downloaded.

trans-unit.source: The vault credential file is valid for only 48 hours after it’s downloaded from the portal.
trans-unit.target: The vault credential file is valid for only 48 hours after it’s downloaded from the portal.

trans-unit.source: If you encounter an error on this page (such as “Vault credentials file provided has expired”), sign in to the portal and download the vault credential file again.
trans-unit.target: If you encounter an error on this page (such as “Vault credentials file provided has expired”), sign in to the portal and download the vault credential file again.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the vault credential file is available in a location that can be accessed by the setup application.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the vault credential file is available in a location that can be accessed by the setup application.

trans-unit.source: If you encounter access-related errors, copy the vault credential file to a temporary location on the same machine and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: If you encounter access-related errors, copy the vault credential file to a temporary location on the same machine and retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: If you encounter a vault credential error such as “Invalid vault credentials provided," the file is damaged or does not have the latest credentials associated with the recovery service.
trans-unit.target: If you encounter a vault credential error such as “Invalid vault credentials provided," the file is damaged or does not have the latest credentials associated with the recovery service.

trans-unit.source: Retry the operation after downloading a new vault credential file from the portal.
trans-unit.target: Retry the operation after downloading a new vault credential file from the portal.

trans-unit.source: This error can also occur if a user clicks the **Download vault credential** option several times in quick succession.
trans-unit.target: This error can also occur if a user clicks the **Download vault credential** option several times in quick succession.

trans-unit.source: In this case, only the last vault credential file is valid.
trans-unit.target: In this case, only the last vault credential file is valid.

trans-unit.source: On the Encryption Setting page, you can either generate a passphrase or provide a passphrase (with a minimum of 16 characters).
trans-unit.target: On the Encryption Setting page, you can either generate a passphrase or provide a passphrase (with a minimum of 16 characters).

trans-unit.source: Remember to save the passphrase in a secure location.
trans-unit.target: Remember to save the passphrase in a secure location.

trans-unit.source: Click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: The Register Server Wizard registers the server with Backup.
trans-unit.target: The Register Server Wizard registers the server with Backup.

trans-unit.source: If you lose or forget the passphrase, Microsoft cannot help you recover the backup data.
trans-unit.target: If you lose or forget the passphrase, Microsoft cannot help you recover the backup data.

trans-unit.source: You own the encryption passphrase, and Microsoft does not have visibility into the passphrase that you use.
trans-unit.target: You own the encryption passphrase, and Microsoft does not have visibility into the passphrase that you use.

trans-unit.source: Save the file in a secure location because it will be required during a recovery operation.
trans-unit.target: Save the file in a secure location because it will be required during a recovery operation.

trans-unit.source: After the encryption key is set, leave the **Launch Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent** check box selected, and then click **Close**
trans-unit.target: After the encryption key is set, leave the **Launch Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent** check box selected, and then click **Close**

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Complete the initial backup
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Complete the initial backup

trans-unit.source: The initial backup includes two key tasks:
trans-unit.target: The initial backup includes two key tasks:

trans-unit.source: Creating the backup schedule
trans-unit.target: Creating the backup schedule

trans-unit.source: Backing up files and folders for the first time
trans-unit.target: Backing up files and folders for the first time

trans-unit.source: After the backup policy completes the initial backup, it creates backup points that you can use if you need to recover the data.
trans-unit.target: After the backup policy completes the initial backup, it creates backup points that you can use if you need to recover the data.

trans-unit.source: The backup policy does this based on the schedule that you define.
trans-unit.target: The backup policy does this based on the schedule that you define.

trans-unit.source: To schedule the backup
trans-unit.target: To schedule the backup

trans-unit.source: Open the Microsoft Azure Backup agent.
trans-unit.target: Open the Microsoft Azure Backup agent.

trans-unit.source: (It will open automatically if you left the **Launch Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent** check box selected when you closed the Register Server Wizard.) You can find it by searching your machine for **Microsoft Azure Backup**
trans-unit.target: (It will open automatically if you left the **Launch Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent** check box selected when you closed the Register Server Wizard.) You can find it by searching your machine for **Microsoft Azure Backup**

trans-unit.source: Launch the Azure Backup agent
trans-unit.target: Launch the Azure Backup agent

trans-unit.source: In the Backup agent, click **Schedule Backup**
trans-unit.target: In the Backup agent, click **Schedule Backup**

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server backup

trans-unit.source: On the Getting started page of the Schedule Backup Wizard, click **Next**
trans-unit.target: On the Getting started page of the Schedule Backup Wizard, click **Next**

trans-unit.source: On the Select Items to Backup page, click **Add Items**
trans-unit.target: On the Select Items to Backup page, click **Add Items**

trans-unit.source: Select the files and folders that you want to back up, and then click **Okay**
trans-unit.target: Select the files and folders that you want to back up, and then click **Okay**

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**

trans-unit.source: On the **Specify Backup Schedule** page, specify the **backup schedule** and click **Next**
trans-unit.target: On the **Specify Backup Schedule** page, specify the **backup schedule** and click **Next**

trans-unit.source: You can schedule daily (at a maximum rate of three times per day) or weekly backups.
trans-unit.target: You can schedule daily (at a maximum rate of three times per day) or weekly backups.

trans-unit.source: Items for Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Items for Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to specify the backup schedule, see the article [Use Azure Backup to replace your tape infrastructure](backup-azure-backup-cloud-as-tape.md)
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to specify the backup schedule, see the article [Use Azure Backup to replace your tape infrastructure](backup-azure-backup-cloud-as-tape.md)

trans-unit.source: On the **Select Retention Policy** page, select the **Retention Policy** for the backup copy.
trans-unit.target: On the **Select Retention Policy** page, select the **Retention Policy** for the backup copy.

trans-unit.source: The retention policy specifies the duration for which the backup will be stored.
trans-unit.target: The retention policy specifies the duration for which the backup will be stored.

trans-unit.source: Rather than just specifying a “flat policy” for all backup points, you can specify different retention policies based on when the backup occurs.
trans-unit.target: Rather than just specifying a “flat policy” for all backup points, you can specify different retention policies based on when the backup occurs.

trans-unit.source: You can modify the daily, weekly, monthly, and yearly retention policies to meet your needs.
trans-unit.target: You can modify the daily, weekly, monthly, and yearly retention policies to meet your needs.

trans-unit.source: On the Choose Initial Backup Type page, choose the initial backup type.
trans-unit.target: On the Choose Initial Backup Type page, choose the initial backup type.

trans-unit.source: Leave the option **Automatically over the network** selected, and then click **Next**
trans-unit.target: Leave the option **Automatically over the network** selected, and then click **Next**

trans-unit.source: You can back up automatically over the network, or you can back up offline.
trans-unit.target: You can back up automatically over the network, or you can back up offline.

trans-unit.source: The remainder of this article describes the process for backing up automatically.
trans-unit.target: The remainder of this article describes the process for backing up automatically.

trans-unit.source: If you prefer to do an offline backup, review the article [Offline backup workflow in Azure Backup](backup-azure-backup-import-export.md) for additional information.
trans-unit.target: If you prefer to do an offline backup, review the article [Offline backup workflow in Azure Backup](backup-azure-backup-import-export.md) for additional information.

trans-unit.source: On the Confirmation page, review the information, and then click **Finish**
trans-unit.target: On the Confirmation page, review the information, and then click **Finish**

trans-unit.source: After the wizard finishes creating the backup schedule, click **Close**
trans-unit.target: After the wizard finishes creating the backup schedule, click **Close**

trans-unit.source: Enable network throttling (optional)
trans-unit.target: Enable network throttling (optional)

trans-unit.source: The Backup agent provides network throttling.
trans-unit.target: The Backup agent provides network throttling.

trans-unit.source: Throttling controls how network bandwidth is used during data transfer.
trans-unit.target: Throttling controls how network bandwidth is used during data transfer.

trans-unit.source: This control can be helpful if you need to back up data during work hours but do not want the backup process to interfere with other Internet traffic.
trans-unit.target: This control can be helpful if you need to back up data during work hours but do not want the backup process to interfere with other Internet traffic.

trans-unit.source: Throttling applies to back up and restore activities.
trans-unit.target: Throttling applies to back up and restore activities.

trans-unit.source: To enable network throttling
trans-unit.target: To enable network throttling

trans-unit.source: In the Backup agent, click **Change Properties**
trans-unit.target: In the Backup agent, click **Change Properties**

trans-unit.source: Change properties
trans-unit.target: Change properties

trans-unit.source: On the **Throttling** tab, select the **Enable internet bandwidth usage throttling for backup operations** check box.
trans-unit.target: On the **Throttling** tab, select the **Enable internet bandwidth usage throttling for backup operations** check box.

trans-unit.source: Network throttling
trans-unit.target: Network throttling

trans-unit.source: After you have enabled throttling, specify the allowed bandwidth for backup data transfer during **Work hours** and **Non-work hours**
trans-unit.target: After you have enabled throttling, specify the allowed bandwidth for backup data transfer during **Work hours** and **Non-work hours**

trans-unit.source: The bandwidth values begin at 512 kilobytes per second (KBps) and can go up to 1,023 megabytes per second (MBps).
trans-unit.target: The bandwidth values begin at 512 kilobytes per second (KBps) and can go up to 1,023 megabytes per second (MBps).

trans-unit.source: You can also designate the start and finish for **Work hours**, and which days of the week are considered work days.
trans-unit.target: You can also designate the start and finish for **Work hours**, and which days of the week are considered work days.

trans-unit.source: Hours outside of designated work hours are considered non-work hours.
trans-unit.target: Hours outside of designated work hours are considered non-work hours.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**

trans-unit.source: To back up now
trans-unit.target: To back up now

trans-unit.source: In the Backup agent, click **Back Up Now** to complete the initial seeding over the network.
trans-unit.target: In the Backup agent, click **Back Up Now** to complete the initial seeding over the network.

trans-unit.source: Windows Server backup now
trans-unit.target: Windows Server backup now

trans-unit.source: On the Confirmation page, review the settings that the Back Up Now Wizard will use to back up the machine.
trans-unit.target: On the Confirmation page, review the settings that the Back Up Now Wizard will use to back up the machine.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Back Up**
trans-unit.target: Then click **Back Up**

trans-unit.source: Click **Close** to close the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Click **Close** to close the wizard.

trans-unit.source: If you do this before the backup process finishes, the wizard continues to run in the background.
trans-unit.target: If you do this before the backup process finishes, the wizard continues to run in the background.

trans-unit.source: After the initial backup is completed, the **Job completed** status appears in the Backup console.
trans-unit.target: After the initial backup is completed, the **Job completed** status appears in the Backup console.

trans-unit.source: IR complete
trans-unit.target: IR complete

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Sign up for a [free Azure account](https://azure.microsoft.com/free/)
trans-unit.target: Sign up for a [free Azure account](https://azure.microsoft.com/free/)

trans-unit.source: For additional information about backing up VMs or other workloads, see:
trans-unit.target: For additional information about backing up VMs or other workloads, see:

trans-unit.source: Back up IaaS VMs
trans-unit.target: Back up IaaS VMs

trans-unit.source: Back up workloads to Azure with Microsoft Azure Backup Server
trans-unit.target: Back up workloads to Azure with Microsoft Azure Backup Server

trans-unit.source: Back up workloads to Azure with DPM
trans-unit.target: Back up workloads to Azure with DPM
